intro: Omphalodes vaniotii, commonly known as the Vaniot's omphalodes, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
